title: How to Install the YouTube App on Your Kindle Fire

steps.title: Open the Device menu.
steps.content: Open the Device menu. The tablet has a feature that only lets you install apps from the official Amazon App Store. You can turn it off easily by first swiping down on your home screen to open the Device menu.

steps.title: Switch on sideloading apps.
steps.content: Switch on sideloading apps. Below Date and Time, you will see “Allow Installation of Applications” set to OFF. Press the ON button to let you install apps from Unknown Sources. This should let you install apps on your tablet that you’ve downloaded from sources other than the official app store.

steps.title: Find and download a YouTube installer from the Internet.
steps.content: Find and download a YouTube installer from the Internet. There are several sites where you can get a YouTube installer; just search for one.

steps.title: Connect your tablet to your computer.
steps.content: Connect your tablet to your computer. Plug in your tablet via the USB cord into your computer, then open “My Computer” on Windows, or the new drive icon that appears on your Mac desktop.

steps.title: Copy the YouTube apk you downloaded.
steps.content: Copy the YouTube apk you downloaded. Navigate to your downloads folder and right-click on the downloaded apk file. Select “Copy” from the context menu.

steps.title: Paste the file into your Kindles storage.
steps.content: Paste the file into your Kindles storage. Navigate to the Kindle’s Internal Storage, right-click an empty area, and select “Paste.”

steps.title: Disconnect your Kindle.
steps.content: Disconnect your Kindle. Do this by pressing the “Disconnect” button on the screen and removing the USB cord from the charging jack.

steps.title: Download ES File Explorer onto your Kindle Fire.
steps.content: Download ES File Explorer onto your Kindle Fire. You can download the ES File Explorer through the Amazon app store. Tap the Store button at the upper-right corner of your home screen then search for ES File Explorer on the search bar at the top. Select the first result, which is free, and install it by pressing the “Install” button at the left side.

steps.title: Open the ES File explorer app.
steps.content: Open the ES File explorer app. Do this by tapping on its app on your home screen.

steps.title: Navigate to the apk file.
steps.content: Navigate to the apk file. Use the ES File Explorer to navigate to the place where you pasted the YouTube apk file.

steps.title: Install YouTube.
steps.content: Install YouTube. Tap the apk file, and the app installation should begin. Press “Install” when you’ve read the app permissions, and when the installation finishes, YouTube should appear as an accessible app on your Kindle’s app menu.
